titles.title: A bill to designate the Federal Building located at 1801 Gulf Breeze Parkway, Gulf Breeze, Florida, as the "Bob Sikes Visitor Center".

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Burdick without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 636.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Referred to House Committee on Public Works and Transportation.
Referred to Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Executive Comment Requested from DOT, OMB.
Referred to Subcommittee on Surface Transportation.

bill.summary: 5/16/1988--Passed Senate amended. (Measure passed Senate, amended) Designates the Federal building at 1801 Gulf Breeze Parkway, Gulf Breeze, Florida, as the Bob Sikes Visitor Center. Directs the Secretary of Transportation, upon the request of the Ohio Turnpike Commission, to enter into an agreement providing that toll revenues from the Ohio Turnpike facility will be used only on such facility for construction and reconstruction costs and for the costs necessary for the proper operation and debt service of such facility. Voids a previous agreement entered into with the Commission and the State of Ohio.
